text: in Kiev a communist idol came crashing
down anti-government protesters toppled
Vladimir Lenin the Russian revolutionary
with sledgehammers they smashed to
pieces this symbol of Russian influence
over Ukraine everyone wanted their piece
of Lenin it's the most sought-after
souvenir now in Kiev Ukrainian is free
now and its symbol of our revolution in
our freedom the destruction of this
statute shows just how keen these people
are to reject Ukraine's traditional ties
with Russia but they suspect their
president is trying to push their
country towards an economic union with
Moscow earlier hundreds of thousands of
demonstrators had packed out the main
square they demanded the government
resign for rejecting closer ties with
the EU in favor of better relations with
Russia these are the demands of
Ukrainian people that fight that fight
for justice and for their future and for
their freedoms and liberties some
government supporters did make it onto
the street there were long rows of
police to protect them
the pro-europe protests are continuing
but Ukraine's Security Service says it's
investigating some of the opposition
leaders on suspicion of planning a coup
Steve Rosenberg BBC News PFF
